Key Match Events: The Utah Jazz lost to the Miami Heat with a score of 97-92.
Utah's defensive effort was much better against Miami, holding the Heat to 28% from three and under 40% from two.
Miami was under 100 points for just the second time since Nov. 27.
Post-Match Reflections: Jazz coach Will Hardy emphasized the importance of valuing every minute on the floor and not taking it for granted.
Hardy noted that the Jazz are playing better after a dismal start, showing progress in both offensive and defensive ratings since Dec. 26.
Hardy reflected on the cohesion of the group and the learning curve of the rookie class, which is starting to get more opportunities.
Others: Johnny Juzang's development was highlighted, with comparisons to Heat forward Duncan Robinson as a model for becoming a reliable three-point shooter with length on defense.
Rookie Isaiah Collier played 33 minutes and finished the game, showing improvement in decision-making and understanding of his teammates.
Rookie Cody Williams played 23 minutes and had critical minutes down the stretch, focusing on increasing his physicality on defense.
Rookie Kyle Filipowski also played 23 minutes and had critical minutes down the stretch.
